title: Luke Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 14.

questions.question: Who invited Jesus to eat bread on the sabbath day in Luke 14?
questions.correctAnswer: A chief Pharisee
questions.explanation: Luke 14:1 states that Jesus went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day.

questions.question: What was the condition of the man who was before Jesus in Luke 14?
questions.correctAnswer: Dropsy
questions.explanation: Luke 14:2 mentions a certain man before Jesus who had dropsy.

questions.question: What question did Jesus ask the lawyers and Pharisees about healing on the sabbath?
options: Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?
Should we fast on the sabbath?
Can we work on the sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?
questions.explanation: Jesus asked if it is lawful to heal on the sabbath day as recorded in Luke 14:3.

questions.question: What did Jesus do to the man with dropsy on the sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: He healed him
questions.explanation: Luke 14:4 tells us Jesus took the man, healed him, and let him go.

questions.question: What example did Jesus give about pulling an animal out of a pit on the sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: An ass or an ox
questions.explanation: In Luke 14:5 Jesus asked who would not pull an ass or an ox out of a pit on the sabbath.

questions.question: What did Jesus advise about choosing seats at a wedding?
options: Do not sit in the highest room
questions.correctAnswer: Do not sit in the highest room
questions.explanation: Luke 14:8 says Jesus told them not to sit down in the highest room when bidden to a wedding.

questions.question: According to Jesus, what happens to those who exalt themselves?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be abased
questions.explanation: Luke 14:11 states that whoever exalts himself shall be abased.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say to invite to your feast instead of friends or rich neighbors?
options: The poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind
questions.correctAnswer: The poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind
questions.explanation: Luke 14:13 instructs to invite the poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind to your feast.

questions.question: What blessing is promised to those who invite the poor and disabled to their feast?
options: They shall be recompensed at the resurrection of the just
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be recompensed at the resurrection of the just
questions.explanation: Luke 14:14 promises a blessing and recompense at the resurrection of the just for inviting those who cannot repay you.

questions.question: What did the invited guests do when the servant told them the supper was ready?
questions.correctAnswer: They all made excuses
questions.explanation: Luke 14:18 explains that all the invited began to make excuses for not coming.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that anyone who hates their family cannot be his disciple.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 14:26 states that one must hate father, mother, wife, children, brethren, sisters, and even their own life to be Jesus' disciple.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 14, carrying your cross is not necessary to be Jesus' disciple.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 14:27 says that whoever does not bear his cross and come after Jesus cannot be his disciple.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that salt losing its savor is good for the land.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 14:34-35 says if salt loses its savor, it is neither fit for the land nor the dunghill, but is cast out.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'For whosoever exalteth himself shall be ______; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.'
questions.correctAnswer: abased
questions.explanation: Luke 14:11 teaches that those who exalt themselves will be abased, and the humble will be exalted.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: disciple
questions.explanation: Luke 14:26 clearly states that one must hate family and even their own life to be Jesus' disciple.

medium.title: Luke Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Luke 14 teach us about humility in social settings?
options: Sit in the highest place to show your status
Sit in the lowest place and be honored later
questions.correctAnswer: Sit in the lowest place and be honored later
questions.explanation: Luke 14:8-10 teaches that one should choose the lowest room when invited, so that the host may invite you higher, honoring you in front of others. This shows humility and trust in God's timing for exaltation.

questions.question: What principle about generosity and rewards does Jesus illustrate when advising whom to invite to a feast?
options: Invite the poor and disabled who cannot repay you
Invite only those who will repay you
questions.correctAnswer: Invite the poor and disabled who cannot repay you
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs in Luke 14:12-14 to invite those who cannot repay, such as the poor, lame, and blind, promising blessings and a reward at the resurrection of the just, emphasizing selfless generosity.

questions.question: According to Luke 14, what is a necessary attitude for someone who wants to be Jesus' disciple?
options: To love family and self more than Jesus
To hate family and even one's own life
questions.correctAnswer: To hate family and even one's own life
questions.explanation: Luke 14:26-27 explains that discipleship requires putting Jesus above all, even one's closest family and life, and bearing one’s cross, indicating commitment and sacrifice.

questions.question: What lesson about planning and perseverance does Jesus teach through the examples of building a tower and going to war?
options: Start without planning to rely fully on God
Plan carefully and count the cost before starting
Avoid all challenges to prevent failure
Use deceit to win at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Plan carefully and count the cost before starting
questions.explanation: Luke 14:28-32 emphasizes the importance of wise planning and considering the cost to finish what one starts, teaching about perseverance and responsibility in following Christ.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about salt that has lost its savor, and how does this relate to a believer’s witness?
options: Salt without savor is still useful for seasoning
Salt without savor is thrown out and useless
Salt without savor is a symbol of abundance
questions.correctAnswer: Salt without savor is thrown out and useless
questions.explanation: Luke 14:34-35 uses salt losing its savor as a metaphor for believers losing their distinctiveness and effectiveness, underscoring the need for spiritual integrity and perseverance.

questions.question: When Jesus healed a man with dropsy on the Sabbath, what principle about mercy and obedience does He demonstrate?
options: Strictly follow traditions even if it means no mercy
Mercy and doing good take precedence over legalism
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and doing good take precedence over legalism
questions.explanation: In Luke 14:1-6, Jesus heals on the Sabbath and points out that rescuing an animal on the Sabbath is lawful, teaching that mercy and doing good are more important than rigid rule-keeping.

questions.question: How does Luke 14 instruct us about responding to excuses when sharing the invitation to God's kingdom?
options: Accept excuses and do not invite further
Ignore excuses and invite others urgently
Only invite those with no excuses
questions.correctAnswer: Ignore excuses and invite others urgently
questions.explanation: Luke 14:16-24 shows that after invited guests made excuses, the master sent his servant to invite the poor and others from streets and highways, illustrating persistence in evangelism.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the cost of discipleship and possessions?
options: Possessions are more important than discipleship
Forsaking all possessions is necessary to be His disciple
Keep possessions but follow Jesus loosely
questions.correctAnswer: Forsaking all possessions is necessary to be His disciple
questions.explanation: Luke 14:33 teaches that anyone who does not forsake all his possessions cannot be Jesus' disciple, highlighting complete commitment and surrender.

questions.question: A believer struggles with pride and wants recognition. Based on Luke 14, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Exalt yourself and others will honor you
Humble yourself to be exalted by God
Ignore humility as it is outdated
questions.correctAnswer: Humble yourself to be exalted by God
questions.explanation: Luke 14:11 states whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted, teaching the importance of humility before God and others.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 14, Jesus expects His followers to prioritize their own life above all other relationships.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 14:26 teaches that a disciple must 'hate' even his own life compared to his love for Jesus, indicating that following Christ requires putting Him above all relationships and self-interest.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus teaches in Luke 14 that it is lawful and right to do good on the Sabbath, including healing the sick.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 14:3-6 shows Jesus healing a man on the Sabbath and explaining that doing good on the Sabbath is lawful, emphasizing mercy over strict Sabbath rules.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'If anyone comes to me and does not ____ his father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, and even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.'
questions.correctAnswer: hate
questions.explanation: Luke 14:26 uses strong language to indicate that loyalty to Jesus must surpass all other relationships, symbolically using 'hate' to express priority and commitment.

questions.question: What does the parable of the great supper teach about God's invitation to salvation?
options: Only the wealthy and important are invited
Many excuse themselves, so the invitation is extended to the marginalized
The invitation is limited to a select few
questions.correctAnswer: Many excuse themselves, so the invitation is extended to the marginalized
questions.explanation: Luke 14:16-24 shows invited guests making excuses, leading the host to invite the poor and outcasts, illustrating God's inclusive call to salvation regardless of status.

questions.question: In Luke 14, what does bearing one's cross symbolize for a disciple?
options: Enduring suffering and commitment to Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Enduring suffering and commitment to Christ
questions.explanation: Luke 14:27 teaches that to follow Jesus, one must bear their cross, meaning willingly accepting hardships and commitment involved in discipleship.

questions.question: How does Luke 14 instruct believers to view social status and recognition in the kingdom of God?
options: Seek the highest seats to gain honor
Humble yourself and accept lower status
Ignore others and seek personal glory
questions.correctAnswer: Humble yourself and accept lower status
questions.explanation: Luke 14:7-11 teaches humility in social situations, warning against self-exaltation and promising exaltation for the humble, aligning with Christian contentment and trust in God.

hard.title: Luke Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 14.

questions.question: What was the ailment of the man who was present before Jesus at the Pharisee's house on the Sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: Dropsy
questions.explanation: Luke 14:2 identifies the man as one who had dropsy, an abnormal accumulation of fluid in the body.

questions.question: In Luke 14, Jesus asks if it is lawful to do what on the Sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: Heal
questions.explanation: Jesus questions the Pharisees about the lawfulness of healing on the Sabbath, highlighting the tension between legalism and mercy (Luke 14:3).

questions.question: According to Jesus in Luke 14, what example does He use to justify helping on the Sabbath?
options: Pulling an ox out of a pit
questions.correctAnswer: Pulling an ox out of a pit
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the example of rescuing an ox or a donkey that has fallen into a pit on the Sabbath to illustrate the principle of doing good on the holy day (Luke 14:5).

questions.question: In His parable about seating at a wedding, where does Jesus advise a guest to sit initially?
questions.correctAnswer: Lowest room
questions.explanation: Jesus advises guests to take the lowest seat first so they might be honored later rather than humiliated if asked to move (Luke 14:10).

questions.question: What principle is taught in the statement, 'For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted'?
questions.correctAnswer: Humility is rewarded
questions.explanation: This principle emphasizes the value of humility and the reversal of status in God's kingdom (Luke 14:11).

questions.question: Whom does Jesus instruct to invite when making a feast according to Luke 14?
options: The poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind
questions.correctAnswer: The poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches to invite those who cannot repay, highlighting selfless generosity (Luke 14:13).

questions.question: What promise does Jesus give for inviting the poor and disabled to a feast?
options: You shall be blessed at the resurrection of the just
You will be rewarded with riches
Your guests will repay your kindness
questions.correctAnswer: You shall be blessed at the resurrection of the just
questions.explanation: Jesus assures that such generosity will be rewarded in the resurrection, not by earthly repayment (Luke 14:14).

questions.question: In the parable of the great supper, what excuses do the invited guests make?
options: Buying a field, testing oxen, and marrying a wife
Sick family members, traveling, and work commitments
Fear of social disgrace, poverty, and exile
questions.correctAnswer: Buying a field, testing oxen, and marrying a wife
questions.explanation: These excuses reflect worldly priorities that reject God's invitation (Luke 14:18-20).

questions.question: What does the master of the house do after the invited guests make excuses and refuse to come to the supper?
options: Sends servants to invite the poor, maimed, halt, and blind
Gives the feast to the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: Sends servants to invite the poor, maimed, halt, and blind
questions.explanation: The master extends the invitation to those who were not originally invited, symbolizing the inclusion of the marginalized (Luke 14:21-23).

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give about those first invited to the supper in His parable?
options: None of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper
They will be given a place of honor
They will receive a double portion
They will be forgiven their debts
questions.correctAnswer: None of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper
questions.explanation: Jesus warns that those who reject God's invitation will miss out on His kingdom blessings (Luke 14:24).

questions.question: According to Luke 14, what must a person do to be Jesus' disciple, using strong relational language?
options: Hate father, mother, wife, children, brethren, sisters, and even own life
questions.correctAnswer: Hate father, mother, wife, children, brethren, sisters, and even own life
questions.explanation: Jesus uses hyperbolic language to emphasize that allegiance to Him must surpass all other ties (Luke 14:26).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about bearing one's cross in relation to discipleship?
options: Whoever does not bear his cross and follow cannot be His disciple
Only some disciples bear a cross
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever does not bear his cross and follow cannot be His disciple
questions.explanation: Bearing the cross symbolizes willingness to endure suffering and sacrifice for Christ (Luke 14:27).

questions.question: What analogy does Jesus use to teach about counting the cost before committing to discipleship?
questions.correctAnswer: Building a tower
questions.explanation: Jesus compares discipleship to building a tower, where one must estimate expenses to avoid failure and ridicule (Luke 14:28-30).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the salt that has lost its savor?
options: It is neither fit for the land nor for the dunghill
It can be restored by mixing with fresh salt
It is prized for its rarity
questions.correctAnswer: It is neither fit for the land nor for the dunghill
questions.explanation: Salt losing its flavor is useless and discarded, symbolizing ineffective discipleship (Luke 14:34-35).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus’ teaching in Luke 14 about inviting the poor to a feast parallels Old Testament themes of justice and care for the marginalized.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: This teaching reflects OT themes like those in Isaiah and Deuteronomy emphasizing care for the poor and marginalized (Luke 14:13-14).

theological.title: Luke Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In Luke 14, what is Jesus' response when asked about the lawfulness of healing on the Sabbath?
options: He heals the man and challenges the questioners
He refuses to heal on the Sabbath
He says healing is only for priests
He tells them to wait until after the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: He heals the man and challenges the questioners
questions.explanation: Jesus heals the man with dropsy on the Sabbath and asks which of them would not rescue an animal on the Sabbath, demonstrating mercy over legalism (Luke 14:3-5). This aligns with God's mercy shown in Hosea 6:6, and Christ's authority over the Sabbath in Mark 2:27-28, and healing on the Sabbath in John 5:16-17.

questions.question: What principle about humility does Jesus teach using the parable of the wedding feast?
options: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted
It is better to seek the highest place to gain honor
Guests should compete for the chief seats
Exaltation comes by wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that self-exaltation leads to humiliation, while humility leads to exaltation (Luke 14:7-11). This principle aligns with Proverbs 3:34, James 4:6, 1 Peter 5:6, and Philippians 2:3-4.

questions.question: According to Luke 14, whom should one invite to a feast to receive a true blessing?
options: The poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind
questions.correctAnswer: The poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs to invite those who cannot repay you to be truly blessed and rewarded at the resurrection of the just (Luke 14:12-14). This reflects God’s care for the marginalized as seen in Deuteronomy 15:11, Isaiah 61:1, James 2:5, and Matthew 25:40.

questions.question: What is the consequence for those who were initially invited to the great supper but made excuses not to come?
options: They shall not taste of the supper
They will be given a second invitation
They are forgiven and welcomed anyway
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not taste of the supper
questions.explanation: Those who rejected the invitation to the supper are excluded from it (Luke 14:24). This judgment theme echoes the parable of the wedding feast in Matthew 22:1-14 and the rejection of Israel in Romans 11:11-12, emphasizing the necessity of responding to God's call.

questions.question: In Luke 14, Jesus states that to be his disciple one must 'hate' certain relationships. What is the theological meaning of 'hate' here?
options: To prioritize allegiance to Christ above all other ties
To avoid social interactions with relatives
questions.correctAnswer: To prioritize allegiance to Christ above all other ties
questions.explanation: The term 'hate' is a Semitic expression meaning to love less or place lower priority than Christ (Luke 14:26). This reflects the call to radical discipleship seen in Matthew 10:37, Exodus 20:3, and Philippians 3:8, emphasizing total commitment to Christ over all else.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when he says one must 'bear his cross' to be his disciple?
options: To willingly accept suffering and self-denial for Christ
To carry a literal wooden cross
To avoid persecution at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: To willingly accept suffering and self-denial for Christ
questions.explanation: Bearing one's cross symbolizes readiness to endure suffering and self-sacrifice in following Jesus (Luke 14:27). This is consistent with Paul's teaching in 2 Timothy 3:12, Jesus’ own example in Hebrews 12:2-3, and the call to deny self in Mark 8:34.

questions.question: What does Jesus teach about planning and counting the cost before committing to discipleship?
options: One should carefully consider the cost to avoid shame
Faith requires no planning or consideration
Discipleship is easy and without cost
questions.correctAnswer: One should carefully consider the cost to avoid shame
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the examples of building a tower and a king going to war to illustrate the necessity of counting the cost before following Him (Luke 14:28-32). This principle aligns with Proverbs 24:27, Ecclesiastes 7:8, and Paul's exhortation to endurance in 1 Corinthians 9:24-27.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Luke 14, what is required for anyone to be his disciple regarding their possessions?
options: They must forsake all they have
They must invest in the temple
They can keep their possessions without conditions
questions.correctAnswer: They must forsake all they have
questions.explanation: Jesus states that forsaking all possessions is essential to discipleship (Luke 14:33). This echoes the call to renounce earthly attachments in Matthew 19:21, Acts 2:44-45, and Philippians 3:7-8, emphasizing total surrender to God.

questions.question: What metaphor does Jesus use at the end of Luke 14 to describe the importance of maintaining one's spiritual effectiveness?
options: Salt that has lost its savor is worthless
A lamp hidden under a bushel
questions.correctAnswer: Salt that has lost its savor is worthless
questions.explanation: Jesus uses salt losing its flavor to illustrate the necessity of preserving one’s spiritual vitality (Luke 14:34-35). This imagery aligns with Matthew 5:13 and emphasizes the believer’s call to live distinctively and effectively in the world.

questions.question: How does Jesus illustrate God's inclusive call to salvation in the parable of the great supper?
options: By inviting the poor, maimed, halt, and blind after the original guests refuse
By inviting only the wealthy and powerful
By limiting the invitation to Israelites
questions.correctAnswer: By inviting the poor, maimed, halt, and blind after the original guests refuse
questions.explanation: The parable shows God’s invitation extended beyond the initial guests to the marginalized, symbolizing the inclusion of Gentiles and outcasts (Luke 14:15-23). This reflects Isaiah 56:3-7, Romans 11:11-12, and Revelation 7:9.

questions.question: What is the implied eschatological reward for those who invite the poor and disabled to their feast, according to Luke 14?
options: They will be recompensed at the resurrection of the just
They will be praised by men
questions.correctAnswer: They will be recompensed at the resurrection of the just
questions.explanation: Jesus promises a spiritual reward at the resurrection for those who show selfless hospitality (Luke 14:14). This reflects the doctrine of resurrection and eternal reward in Daniel 12:2, John 5:28-29, and 1 Corinthians 15:52.

questions.question: How does Jesus challenge the Pharisees' legalism regarding the Sabbath in Luke 14?
options: By performing a healing and appealing to mercy
By forbidding any work on the Sabbath
By quoting only the law without explanation
questions.correctAnswer: By performing a healing and appealing to mercy
questions.explanation: Jesus heals a man with dropsy on the Sabbath and uses a reasoning about rescuing animals to expose their hardness of heart (Luke 14:1-6). This challenge to legalism aligns with Hosea 6:6, Matthew 12:7, and the prophetic emphasis on mercy over sacrifice.

questions.question: What does Jesus imply about discipleship and total commitment in his teaching on forsaking all possessions?
options: Without forsaking all, one cannot be his disciple
Discipleship is independent of material things
questions.correctAnswer: Without forsaking all, one cannot be his disciple
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that complete surrender, including material possessions, is necessary for true discipleship (Luke 14:33). This is consistent with the call to renounce all in Luke 18:22, Acts 4:32, and 1 Timothy 6:10-11.

questions.question: What does the parable of the great supper in Luke 14 teach about the kingdom of God and human response?
options: Many reject God's invitation, but it is extended to the marginalized
Only the righteous are invited from the start
The invitation is limited to those of noble birth
questions.correctAnswer: Many reject God's invitation, but it is extended to the marginalized
questions.explanation: The parable illustrates that initial invitees reject God's call, so the invitation extends to the poor and outcasts, revealing God's inclusive kingdom (Luke 14:15-24). This theme is echoed in Matthew 22:1-14 and Isaiah 25:6-9.

questions.question: How does Jesus use the examples of a builder and a king to teach about discipleship?
options: To stress the importance of counting the cost before commitment
To advocate for war against enemies
To discourage planning and rely on impulse
questions.correctAnswer: To stress the importance of counting the cost before commitment
questions.explanation: Jesus compares discipleship to building a tower and going to war, emphasizing the need for thoughtful consideration to avoid shame or defeat (Luke 14:28-32). This principle of wise planning accords with Proverbs 21:5 and Ecclesiastes 3:1.
